intro: Macaranga calcicola, commonly known as the limestone macaranga, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its alternate, simple leaves that are often hairy. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone-rich soils, adapting to nutrient-poor environments. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its ecological significance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
